record.properties: Caption = "Array of POINT" cmembers = lpointer = .F. Name = "arraypoint"
record.methods:
PROCEDURE getcmembers *==================================================================== * In order to use the same structure for arrays of POINT structures * as well as arrays of pointers to POINT structures, we use a * lPOinter property that indicates whether the point structures * should be included or pointed to. *==================================================================== With This
If .lPointer Return "po:Points" Else Return "o:Points" Endif
Endwith ENDPROC
record.reserved3: lpointer ^points[1,0]

record.properties: Caption = "RASENTRYNAME (array)" Width = 150 crasentryname = RASENTRYNAME cmembers = o:Entry Name = "rasentryname_array"
record.methods:
PROCEDURE count *==================================================================== * Returns the number of elements in the RASENTRYNAME array *==================================================================== With This
Return ALen( .Entry )
Endwith ENDPROC PROCEDURE Init *==================================================================== * This array class manages all entries on its own, you don't have * to do anything about it. Part of it means that for every element * in the array, it automatically creates the appropriate structure * object. *==================================================================== With This
If not DoDefault() Return .F. Endif .Entry[1] = CreateObject( .cRASENTRYNAME )
Endwith ENDPROC PROCEDURE setdimension *==================================================================== * Changes the dimension of the array. RASENTRYNAME structures are * created and released as needed. *==================================================================== LParameter tnNewSize With This
Local lnOldSize, lnEntry lnOldSize = ALen( .Entry ) Dimension .Entry[m.tnNewSize] For lnEntry = m.lnOldSize + 1 to m.tnNewSize .Entry[m.lnEntry] = CreateObject( .cRASENTRYNAME ) Endfor .ReQuery()
Endwith ENDPROC
record.reserved3: crasentryname Holds the name of the RASENTRYNAME structure. ^entry[1,0] *setdimension Changes the dimension of the array. *count Returns the number of elements in the array.

record.properties: Caption = "RASDIALPARAMS" Width = 125 dwsize = 0 szentryname = szphonenumber = szcallbacknumber = szusername = szpassword = szdomain = nfill = 4 Name = "rasdialparams"
record.methods:
PROCEDURE getcmembers *==================================================================== * Returns the definition of this structure. Instead of "0c" we use * here "z" for TCHAR and specify a length. The reason we do this is * that TCHAR here is actually interpreted by windows as a NULL * terminated string. With "z" the struct class will stop at the first * occurence of CHR(0). This doesn't matter if you only use a * structure once, but with multiple calls parts from previous calls * might remain in the properties. *====================================================================
Return ; "DWORD l:dwsize," + ; "TCHAR z257:szEntryName," + ; "TCHAR z129:szPhoneNumber," + ; "TCHAR z129:szCallbackNumber," + ; "TCHAR z257:szUserName," + ; "TCHAR z257:szPassWord," + ; "TCHAR z16:szDomain"
ENDPROC PROCEDURE Init *==================================================================== * In this structure the dwSize member must contain the size of the * structure. *==================================================================== With This
If not DoDefault() Return .F. Endif .dwSize = .SizeOf()
Endwith ENDPROC
record.reserved3: dwsize szentryname szphonenumber szcallbacknumber szusername szpassword szdomain

record.properties: Caption = "RASENTRYNAME" Width = 150 dwsize = 0 szentryname = nfill = 4 Name = "rasentryname"
record.methods:
PROCEDURE getcmembers Return ; "DWORD l:dwsize," + ; "TCHAR z257:szEntryName" ENDPROC PROCEDURE Init *==================================================================== * In this structure the dwSize member must contain the size of the * structure. *==================================================================== With This
If not DoDefault() Return .F. Endif .dwSize = .SizeOf()
Endwith ENDPROC
record.reserved3: dwsize szentryname
